decisions.chose: Approach A (structured JSON) with Approach B element (compact summary + codex)
decisions.why: 90% value with minimal risk. Structured JSON is readable/debuggable. Compact summary tests compression without risking data loss.
Buffer content is project-specific. Keeps everything self-contained and git-tracked.

decisions.chose: Concept map — allows multi-word concept entries, not just single terms
decisions.why: Structural concepts like 'totalization-of-envelopment' carry meaning single terms don't

decisions.what: Added suggest field to concept map entries
decisions.chose: Nullable suggest field with null-is-preferred convention
decisions.why: Allows Claude to flag connections without asserting them. Prevents pressure to fill blanks.

decisions.what: Added dialectic as top-level coordinate base
decisions.why: Without metathesis, the other three remain serial and diachronic. Metathesis enables synchronicity.

decisions.chose: Noted as emergent ontological register mapping
decisions.why: Correlation emerges from the terms themselves without forcing

decisions.what: Four-level trust: tau_self, tau_pair, tau_group, tau_context
decisions.chose: tau_context is simultaneously a priori and constructed
decisions.why: Context both conditions and is constituted by agent gestures

decisions.what: Zero is never a valid parameter
decisions.chose: Asymptotic approach triggers metathesis/phase change, not null
decisions.why: Praxis conservation law means zero praxis is impossible

decisions.what: Conservation law = principle of least action
decisions.chose: Structural identity (not just analogy) with Fermat/Feynman
decisions.why: Minimal praxis for maximal syntegration = stationary action

decisions.what: Trust stability metric: CV-squared vs raw variance
decisions.chose: Coefficient of variation squared: cv_sq = var / (mean^2 + eps)
decisions.why: Raw variance is scale-dependent; dM values easily 1-100 making stability always near-zero. CV^2 is scale-invariant.

decisions.what: Junction metric: symmetric vs asymmetric trust
decisions.chose: Symmetric: average of both agents' trust views
decisions.why: Asymmetric junction would make cross-metathesis eligibility depend on evaluation order. Symmetry is more principled.

decisions.what: Absorptive family creation: conditional vs unconditional
decisions.chose: Always create family on absorptive cross (unconditional)
decisions.why: Conditional guard silently skipped first-generation agents, creating data integrity gap. Novel cross and self-metathesis were already unconditional.

decisions.chose: Housekeeping -> exploration run -> Levinas/R&B reflection -> TASKS.md
decisions.why: R&B and Levinas material could reshape 3C roadmap, so TASKS.md comes AFTER discussion, not before.

open_threads.thread: Stage 3B implementation — ALL 7 PHASES COMPLETE. 50 new tests, 345 total.
Exploration run: enable all Stage 3B features, examine trajectory, contrast with Youn empirical data
Reflection & discussion: Levinas material + R&B review for 3C relevance. R&B mapping: Level I->L11, II->L12/L21, III->family groups, IV->L22
TASKS.md generation — deferred until AFTER reflection/discussion
Turbulence reconception needs full rethink of turbulence.py

athesis.collision: != antithesis (antithesis = counter-athesis, a different thing entirely)

metathesis.base: context window / before-after frame / enables synchronicity of the other three. Without metathesis, thesis-athesis-synthesis remain serial and diachronic

condensation.collision: != condension (condension = involution specifically, not the consummation)

condension.base: specific vector of involution / densification / enfolding
condension.collision: != condensation (which is the consummation of evolution+involution)

subterms.rarefaction_condensation: lightlike (propagation at boundary of causal reach)

depression.collision: != clinical depression (though structural parallel may exist)

oppression.collision: != political oppression exclusively (though it includes it)

A._chain_order: anopression <- expression <- impression <- adpression <-> compression -> depression -> suppression -> oppression -> anapression
A._note: alpha parameter = anapressive phase constant (L12 athetic time). sigma parameter = anopressive phase constant (L21 synthetic time). See §5.45

consummation.collision: != consumption (consumption = using structure; consummation = completing through absorption)

habitation.base: praxis as active intentional dwelling (protonomic register)

P._praxis_definition: the process of projection & reflection in consumptive consummation
P._conservation: praxis is always conserved (via consummation in laminar flow). See §5.38
P._practico_inert: gas/fuel — sedimented past praxis storing potential energy. REVERSED from §5.24. See §5.43
P._praxistatic: engine — active interface transforming stored potential into directed work. See §5.43

S._base: how-I-create / creation-axis / synthesis at TAPS level

fusion.base: convergence toward shared hexitive ground (group level)

S._conservation: syntegration is always consumed (via consumption in turbulent flow). See §5.38
S._law: minimal praxis for maximal syntegration = variational principle = principle of least action. See §5.50

RIP._base: direction through TAPS space / flow function. TAP=rate, TAPS=position, RIP=direction
RIP._combinatorics: 8 mode configs (2^3) x 6 orderings (3!) = 48 base states. Power-law nesting: R^(I^P) != (R^I)^P. See §5.30
RIP._death: collapse of RIP flow function / mode-lock (mode-flip frequency -> 0). Not a specific config.
RIP._falsification: Stage 3X-RIP with F1-F8 regime. Must pass F1, F6, F8 to retain. See §5.30

Fermat:least_time.maps_to: conservation law (minimal praxis for maximal syntegration)

Feynman:path_integral.maps_to: conservation law — all paths explored, constructive interference on stationary action

RB:Level_IV.maps_to: cultural / L22 / Mode 4 env drift / tau_context
RB:Level_IV.suggest: Deep review pending — user believes R&B may inform 3C

validation_log.detail: All entries created from design doc §4.2-4.8. Dialectic, T, A, P, S, RIP groups and cross_source mappings.
All 7 phases were pure implementation of existing concepts (Xi, sigma, trust, mu, families, junction). No new theoretical concepts introduced.
Added RB:Level_I-IV cross_source entries mapping Ruesch & Bateson communication levels to L-matrix channels and trust tiers. Preliminary — deep review pending.

encoding.0!=null: zero is never valid — asymptotic null triggers phase change
encoding.sigma(Xi): sigma-TAP feedback loop: B = sigma(Xi) * B_raw
encoding.mu-endo: endogenous mu (death rate modulated by affordance)
encoding.§X.Y: design doc forward note section X.Y

rules: Abbrevs: T/A/P/S = TAPS letters, R/I/P = RIP positions
